title: COVID-19: Vaccine Information
cleaned_text: Information](#vaccine_info) Effective July 7, 2023, individuals 5 years and older are recommended to wait until Fall 2023 to receive their next COVID-19 booster dose. Peak circulation of COVID-19 is expected in the fall during respiratory virus season. Receiving a booster dose at that time will provide maximum protection against the virus. It may be appropriate for some individuals to receive a booster prior to Fall 2023 based on their unique health status and personal situation. Consult with a health care provider if you are considering receiving a booster prior to Fall 2023. More information on fall booster doses will be available in the coming months. Booking an Appointment Step 1: Learn about the COVID-19 Vaccines Learn [about the COVID-19 Vaccines](https://www.ontario.ca/page/covid-19-vaccines#vaccine-types). Then check if you need to consult a health care provider. You will need to consult a health care provider if you [have severe allergies for a component of the vaccine](https://www.canada.ca/en/health-canada/services/drugs-health-products/covid19-industry/drugs-vaccines-treatments/vaccines.html). We recommend consulting a health care provider if you have any vaccine questions related to your medical history or your child's medical history. If you do not have a health care provider, you can book a virtual appointment: - Online at [Health811](https://pcchu-my.sharepoint.com/personal/sdoris_pcchu_ca/Documents/COVID%20Vaccine%20Info%20Webpage%20Changes.docx)or by calling 811 (TTY: 1-866-797-0007). - Online at [VaxFacts Clinic](https://www.shn.ca/VaxFacts/)or by calling 416-438-2911, 5738 - Online at [SickKids](https://www.sickkids.ca/en/care-services/support-services/covid-19-vaccine-consult/#book) [COVID-19 Vaccine Consult Service](https://www.sickkids.ca/en/care-services/support-services/covid-19-vaccine-consult/#book)or by calling 437-881-3505 Use this [resource](https://covid.gradepro.org/presentations/#/premium/premium_presentation:p_l_motilaa_mcmaster_ca_0_80967094-181a-4ef6-b1ad-b5cc1db272b8_da8c7fb3-717e-4460-b034-9806ad1c2b38) to learn more about who should receive a COVID-19 vaccine. Step 2: Check Vaccine Eligibility 6 months to under 5 years - You are eligible for a 2 dose primary series of bivalent Moderna vaccine. The second dose can be received 2 months (56 days) after the first. In discussion with your health care provider and/or vaccinator you may choose to receive the next dose as early as 28 days after the first. 5 years and older - You are eligible for a 2 dose primary series of either the bivalent Pfizer (preferred for ages 12-29) or bivalent Moderna vaccine. In discussion with your health care provider and/or vaccinator you may choose to receive the next dose as early as 28 days after the first dose. PLEASE NOTE: It is recommended to wait at least 6 months after COVID-19 infection to receive your next dose of the COVID-19 vaccine. Use this [resource](https://covid.gradepro.org/presentations/#/premium/premium_presentation:p_l_motilaa_mcmaster_ca_0_80967094-181a-4ef6-b1ad-b5cc1db272b8_a4730423-8584-40f7-845e-493fe326018f) to learn more. 6 months to under 5 years - You are eligible for a 3 dose primary series of the bivalent Moderna vaccine. Each dose can be received 2 months (56 days) after the previous dose. In discussion with your health care provider and/or vaccinator you may choose to receive each dose as early as 28 days apart. 5 years and older - You are eligible for a 3 dose primary series of either the bivalent Pfizer (preferred for ages 12-29) or bivalent Moderna vaccine. Each dose can be received 2 months (56 days) after the previous dose. In discussion with your health care provider and/or vaccinator you may choose to receive the next dose(s) as early as 28 days after the 1st dose and 28 days after the second dose. PLEASE NOTE: It is recommended to wait at least 6 months after COVID-19 infection to receive your next dose of the COVID-19 vaccine. Use this [resource](https://covid.gradepro.org/presentations/#/premium/premium_presentation:p_l_motilaa_mcmaster_ca_0_80967094-181a-4ef6-b1ad-b5cc1db272b8_a4730423-8584-40f7-845e-493fe326018f) to learn more. Booster doses are available for individuals 5 years and older who have completed their primary series. You are eligible to receive a booster dose 6 months (168 days) after a previous dose or COVID-19 infection. Effective July 7, 2023, individuals 5 years and older are recommended to wait until Fall 2023 to receive their next COVID-19 booster dose. Peak circulation of COVID-19 is expected in the fall during respiratory virus season. Receiving a booster dose at that time will provide maximum protection against the virus. It may be appropriate for some individuals to receive a booster prior to Fall 2023 based on their unique health status and personal situation. Consult with a health care provider if you are considering receiving a booster prior to Fall 2023. More information on fall booster doses will be available in the coming months. You can also confirm your booster eligibility by using the province of Ontario's [Booster Dose Recommendation Tool. ](https://www.ontario.ca/vaccine-eligibility/) PLEASE NOTE: It is recommended to wait at least 6 months after COVID-19 infection to receive your next dose of the COVID-19 vaccine. Use this [resource](https://covid.gradepro.org/presentations/#/premium/premium_presentation:p_l_motilaa_mcmaster_ca_0_80967094-181a-4ef6-b1ad-b5cc1db272b8_a4730423-8584-40f7-845e-493fe326018f) to learn more. The following is a list of vaccine preference for each age group. PLEASE NOTE: supply of these vaccines may fluctuate. If a Peterborough Public Health Clinic is being advertised for a certain age range, we can guarantee that at least one vaccine will be available for that age range. Please review the [PPH clinic calendar](https://www.peterboroughpublichealth.ca/novel-coronavirus-covid-19/novel-coronavirus-covid-19/covid-19-vaccine-clinic/#clinic) for additional info regarding clinic dates and vaccine availability. Primary Series: - 6 months to under 5 years: The bivalent Moderna vaccine. (This is the only bivalent product authorized for this age group) - 6 months to under 5 years (Immunocompromised): The bivalent Moderna vaccine. (This is the only bivalent product authorized for this age group) - 5 to 11 years: There is no preference between the bivalent Pfizer or bivalent Moderna vaccine. - 12 to 29 years: The Bivalent Pfizer vaccine. - 30 years and over: There is no preference between the bivalent Pfizer vaccine or the bivalent Moderna vaccine. Booster Doses: - 6 months to under 5: not eligible for booster doses. - 5 years: The Bivalent Pfizer vaccine. (This is the only bivalent product authorized for this age group). - 6 to 11 years: There is no preference between the bivalent Pfizer vaccine or the bivalent Moderna vaccine. - 12 years and over: There is no preference between the bivalent Pfizer vaccine or the bivalent Moderna vaccine. For information about the Novavax COVID-19 Vaccine Clinic, [click here.](https://www.peterboroughpublichealth.ca/novel-coronavirus-covid-19/covid-19-vaccine-clinic/#novavax) Step 3: Find Vaccine Clinic Upcoming Community Clinics Peterborough Public Health Office 185 King Street, Peterborough, K9J 2R8 For ages 6 months to 11 years - By Appointment ONLY - Tuesday, September 5, 9:30 a.m. - 12:00 p.m. - Tuesday, September 12, 9:30 a.m. - 12:00 p.m. - Tuesday, September 19, 9:30 a.m. - 12:00 p.m. - Tuesday, September 26, 9:30 a.m. - 12:00 p.m. Select Pharmacy Clinics: Select pharmacy locations offer COVID-19 vaccination. Find a [list of all local participating pharmacies](https://www.ontario.ca/vaccine-locations), including how to book an appointment. The vaccine types offered by specific pharmacies may change without notice. Step 4: Book an Appointment Please note - if there are no open appointments listed this indicates that our clinics are full. You may [access a local pharmacy](https://www.ontario.ca/vaccine-locations) or check back the following week for additional clinics. Please do not call PPH directly as all PPH appointments must be booked through the provincial COVID-19 vaccine booking system (unless otherwise stated). You may book an appointment: - online at [covid-19.ontario.ca/book-vaccine](https://covid-19.ontario.ca/book-vaccine/)OR - over the phone Monday to Friday (holidays excluded) from 8:30 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., Eastern Time after 1-833-943-3900 Appointment Information PLEASE NOTE: Mask wearing is required in all PPH COVID-19 Vaccine Clinics. Before attending your appointment: - Complete a [COVID-19 self-assessment](https://www.ontario.ca/self-assessment/). Make sure to cancel your appointment if you do not feel well. - Bring your Ontario health card (preferred) or another form of identification. - Review the adult [Adult (18+) consent form](https://www.health.gov.on.ca/en/pro/programs/publichealth/coronavirus/docs/vaccine/COVID-19_vaccine_consent_form.pdf)or [Youth (12-17) consent form](https://www.health.gov.on.ca/en/pro/programs/publichealth/coronavirus/docs/vaccine/COVID-19_vaccine_consent_form_youth.pdf)before your arrival. You will need to verbally consent at your appointment. - Please avoid wearing scented products as all clinics are scent free. Vaccine Information [Children and Youth Vaccine Information](#children_vaccine) [COVID-19 Vaccine Webinar Resources](#vaccine_webinars) COVID-19 Vaccine Clinic](#novavax) [Additional Resources](#resources) COVID-19 Vaccines for Children and Youth It is important as a parent or guardian to inform yourself and your child before making the personal decision to get the COVID-19 vaccine. Learn more about the COVID-19 vaccine for children ages 6 months to under 12 years: - Visit [SickKids](https://www.aboutkidshealth.ca/Article?contentid=4054&language=English)and the [Ministry of Health](https://www.ontario.ca/page/covid-19-vaccines#section-7)COVID-19 for children and youth webpages - Check out the [Ontario COVID-19 vaccine (ages 5-11) Fact Sheet](https://files.ontario.ca/moh_covid19_youth_vaccination_factsheet_en_2021_11_22.pdf) - Help your children create a [Comfort Care Plan](https://www.peterboroughpublichealth.ca/wp-content/uploads/2021/11/My-Comfort-Care-Plan-All-About-Me.pdf). - Review a Joint Statement from Pediatric Experts: [COVID-19 Vaccination in Children 6 Months to 5 Years of Age in Ontario](https://www.sickkids.ca/en/news/archive/2022/paediatric-infectious-diseases-experts-encourage-covid-19-flu-vaccinations-children-under-five/) COVID-19 Vaccines Webinar Resources [Bivalent Pfizer and Moderna Vaccines Information Session](https://www.instagram.com/p/Cjs6bCsJJWm/)- October 14, 2022, Instagram live recording with Dr. Thomas Piggott, Medical Officer of Health [Paediatric (ages 6 months to 5 years) Vaccine Information Session](https://www.instagram.com/p/CgSmD88pXsv/)- July 21, 2022, Instagram live recording with Dr. Thomas Piggott, Medical Officer of Health [Paediatric (ages 5-11) COVID-19 Vaccine Information Session](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qt4ZrIZvozo)- December 9, 2021, Webinar recording with Dr. Thomas Piggott, Medical Officer of Health Registering a Dose Received Out of Province Those who have received a dose of the COVID-19 vaccine outside of Ontario and need to register it, will need to go through a registration process. To begin this process please contact Peterborough Public Health through one of the following methods: - Complete the online registration form here: [Registry for Out of Province Vaccination](https://s-ca.chkmkt.com/?e=235425&h=2AE0D156DD0AA26&l=en)OR - Email covidvaccine@peterboroughpublichealth.ca Please provide the following details: - Name, phone number, and email address - Reason for calling or emailing - Brand of vaccine received - Date dose(s) had been administered NOTE: this is not a short process; it may take up to 30 days to hear back from Peterborough Public Health. Please be patient. You can book a vaccine appointment through the provincial vaccine booking system if you have an Ontario Health card. If you choose to do this, you MUST bring physical proof (CANNOT be an electronic copy) of your out of province dose. Novavax COVID-19 Vaccine Clinic Peterborough Public Health hosts dedicated clinics for the administration of the [Novavax COVID-19 vaccine.](https://www.canada.ca/en/health-canada/services/drugs-health-products/covid19-industry/drugs-vaccines-treatments/vaccines/novavax.html) If you would like to receive the Novavax COVID-19 vaccine, please contact Peterborough Public Health at 705-743-1000, ext. 397 to be added to the list. You will be contacted when a clinic is available.
